text: The important work of moving the world forward does not wait to be done by perfect men.
author: George Eliot

text: Much may be done in those little shreds and patches of time which every day produces, and which most men throw away.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

text: Men should be like Kleenex, soft, strong and disposable.
author: Cher

text: Men do change, and change comes like a little wind that ruffles the curtains at dawn, and it comes like the stealthy perfume of wildflowers hidden in the grass.
author: John Steinbeck

text: The strength and power of a country depends absolutely on the quantity of good men and women in it.
author: John Ruskin
